masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Check if unauthorized users can access S3 buckets using https://github.com/NetSPI/S3PermissionChecker

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/installing.html
aws s3 cp test.txt s3://bucketNameHere
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Review access controls on the S3 bucket and follow the principle of least privilege when assigning S3 bucket permissions to ensure only authorized users have access to the bucket. Unless the S3 bucket is intended to be publicly available, remove the "Everyone" and "Any Authenticated AWS User" permissions from the AWS S3 bucket. Use pre-signed URLs to allow users that are authenticated to other applications to access or modify S3 buckets.
masterFinding.name: AWS - Unauthorized Access to S3 Bucket
masterFinding.businessImpact: Weak permissions on S3 buckets allow unauthorized users to access contents stored in S3 buckets and upload new content to bucket. Malicious users may gain access to sensitive information, use the S3 bucket for file storage, or overwrite existing content in the bucket.
masterFinding.description: AWS Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket allows unauthorized users to upload or download files.
